qas.question: What was the first state size society in the Vedic period?
What is the dating of the Kuru kingdom?
At the beginning of what age are the dates of the Kuru kingdom?
What is the first Indian text to mention iron?
When the Kuru kingdom declined, to what kingdom did Vedic culture go?

context: The <a0_0>Kuru kingdom<a0_0/> was the first state-level society of the Vedic period, corresponding to the beginning of the <a2_0>Iron Age<a2_0/> in northwestern India, around <a1_0>1200 – 800 BCE<a1_0/>, as well as with the composition of the <a3_0>Atharvaveda<a3_0/> (the first Indian text to mention iron, as śyāma ayas, literally "black metal"). The Kuru state organized the Vedic hymns into collections, and developed the orthodox srauta ritual to uphold the social order. When the Kuru kingdom declined, the center of Vedic culture shifted to their eastern neighbours, the <a4_0>Panchala<a4_0/> kingdom. The archaeological Painted Grey Ware culture, which flourished in the Haryana and western Uttar Pradesh regions of northern India from about 1100 to 600 BCE, is believed to correspond to the Kuru and Panchala kingdoms.
